column1: A_Brickset_user,"2004-06-26T18:01:34Z","Wow!!!!!","I just got this set and it is amazing! It has so many cool things such as the Technic Shock Absorbers that opens the back and the doors on each side of the truck. The steering is great and I love this set!!!!",FALSE,5,0,0,0,0

A_Brickset_user,"2004-12-04T13:08:28Z","Rescue Vehicle With Many Good Features","This set is, allthought rather small (compared to some of my other sets), a great set. The design needs acreditation on its own, it is a very good use of little space to create such detail in this model. then there is the technical stuff in this model, let me just say the vehicle is steered on six of the eight wheels, and that said it is with the fact in mind that not all wheels have the same angle of approch to the center of the turning arc. In short clear words, GOOD MODEL FOR CHEAP MONEY.",FALSE,4,0,0,0,0

,TRUE,5,4,5,5,5 SenatorBlutarsky","2011-06-14T23:40:37.35Z","Great Set From Yesteryear!","

Well, not quite yesteryear, but it has been almost a decade since this set was first released.
column2: I had been looking to score this set for a while and finally found an essentially new copy (no box, but all parts in their original bags) for a&nbsp
column3: little over $40 -- which is a steal, considering that it sold for $70 in 2003.

column1: In any case, the 8454 Rescue Truck is an excellent mid-size Technic set and would be a good buy even at its original price.
column3: an impressive set of functions for a set of around 600 pieces:

column1: <li>A working V6 engine that is driven off the 3rd axle (which has a differential).
<li>Steering of 6 of the 8 wheels (the 1st, 2nd, and 4th axles) via a HOG knob located on the top near the rear of the truck.
<li>A water cannon that may be remotely elevated and turned via another HOG knob/joystick on the top of the truck.
<li>A rear hood that may be released via a small button on the top.&nbsp
column2: A shock absorber opens the hood once it is released.

column1: <li>Doors on each side that may be released by sliding a catch from side to side (only one door may be opened at a time).&nbsp
column2: Once again, a shock absorber opens the door once it is released.

column1: Building this set took me about two and a half hours.
column2: The complexity of the build is pretty good for a set of this size -- it includes a number of&nbsp
column5: A few specific notes on the build:

column1: <li>The instructions for the water cannon assembly seem to be slightly incorrect.&nbsp
column2: If the instructions are followed exactly, the flex rod that forms the hose appears to be attached too far forward, and it forces the cannon to point downward.&nbsp
column3: Moving the attachment point back a few studs solves this problem completely.

column1: <li>The gear casing at the rear of the engine block is little too tight on the 12T gear that drives the crankshaft.&nbsp
column2: If the triangular liftarm at the rear of this assembly is forced all the way down onto the gear, it adds a lot of friction to the drive train.&nbsp
column3: It's best to back this piece off a millimeter or two.

column1: When the build is complete, the result is one great looking
column3: modest number of stickers are not applied.&nbsp
column4: The design makes good use of curved panels to give the truck a steamlined, futuristic look that is fairly unique among all of the Technic sets.

column3: By comparison, the 8053 Mobile Crane, which also has 8 wheels (all of which are steered), is not nearly as maneuverable as the 8454 Rescue Truck.&nbsp
column4: The water cannon joystick mechanism also works very well, even if it is a little simplistic.&nbsp
column5: The automatically opening doors are a very cool feature.&nbsp
column6: The only negative there is that the catch mechanism that holds the side doors closed is a little clunky and&nbsp
column7: prevents (unnecessarily, I think) both doors from being opened simultaneously.

column1: For someone who has recently returned to Legos, this set is a treasure trove of parts.
column3: contains a large number of pieces that have been&nbsp
column6: -- clear cylinder blocks, red panels of all shapes and sizes, black 2L axles, and the 56x30 balloon tires, which are much more rugged than the 56x26 tires used on the&nbsp

column1: In summary, I give this set very high marks all around.
column2:
It is well designed, fun to build, fun to play with, and it can still be found for a very reasonable price.

",TRUE,5,5,4,4,5
